hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Compression Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC enters a period of low volatility (Bollinger Band Width < 0.05) within a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-period upper Bollinger Band on a closing basis, accompanied by volume exceeding the 20-day average by 150%, will lead to a sustained directional move in the breakout direction over the next 5-10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often feature range-bound price action and volatility compression. A high-volume breakout from such a compression zone signals a potential shift in market structure and the initiation of a new trend, as accumulated energy is released. The volume filter helps distinguish genuine breakouts from false moves.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Bollinger Band Width < 0.05 for at least 5 consecutive days
BTC closes above its 20-day upper Bollinger Band
Daily volume > 150% of its 20-day moving average on breakout day

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Re-entry below the 20-day moving average on a closing basis
exit_conditions.time_exit: 10 days after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average 5-day forward return following such a signal is not statistically significantly greater than zero (p > 0.05) or is negative.
